project_descr: UNDP, jointly with UNFPA and in coordination with the Ministry of Health, are supporting activities to addressing stigma and discrimination associated with most at risk populations (MAPRs) vulnerable to HIV/AIDs in Suriname.

outputs.output_descr: UNDP, jointly with UNFPA and in coordination with the Ministry of Health, is in the process of designing a comprehensive project to support addressing, inter alia, stigma and discrimination associated with HIV/AIDs in Suriname, and UNDP and UNFPA will be pursuing the following activities included in the Initiation Plan while the larger programme is being developed: i. Capacity Building Programme for NGOs working with MARPs and HIV AIDS in Suriname; Dissemination of materials to address stigma and discrimination associated with HIV/AIDS through NGOs; iii. Awareness rising campaign on stigma and discrimination associated with HIV/AIDS targeting the private sector in Suriname; iv. Distribution of awareness rising materials in commemoration of the World Aids Day; v. Design of a comprehensive Project Document.
